page.title: 18CHEDDAR CHEESE
page.content: {Cheddar Cheese}forms part of the hard cheese group. Cheddar is probably the most famous kind of cheese. It comes in both{mild and mature varieties.}It gets its name from Cheddar gorge and the village. Cheddar cheese is not made in Cheddar any longer although there is one small factory at the bottom of the gorge where visitors can see the famous chees being made. {How the cheese is made:-} 1. fresh milk is pasteurised and a starter of special bacteria is added to sour the milk. Later rennet is added. 2. solid curds and liquid whey are formed the whey being drained off. 3. the curd is chopped and salted and then moulded and pressed to remove any remaining whey. The cheese is then allowed to ripen. The flavour develops as the cheese gets older.
